intro: Elaeocarpus polystachyus var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean elaeocarp, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and showy, clustered white flowers. The tree produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, this species is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
